TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit DirectoryProvider extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Static factory to retrieve application and device directory from HealthVault.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Health.ApplicationDirectoryItem> GetApplicationDirectoryCollection (Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.DirectoryDataOptions options, out Nullable<DateTime> responseLastModified);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationDirectoryItem> GetApplicationDirectoryCollection(class Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceConnection connection, valuetype Microsoft.Health.DirectoryDataOptions options, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTime> responseLastModified) cil managed

Docs.param: defines what set of data in (s) to retrieve. The calling application can request all languages for the response return values.
Returns the response's last modified datetime
Docs.summary: Gets the list of application directory items from HealthVault.

returns.para: A collection of application directory items with localized element values available for the best match language or all languages as specified by the . In case of a language match, HealthVault service tries to find caller's current language identifier by first trying to match entire language specifier in the request (e.g. es-US), then just the language base (e.g. es), and as last resort, defaults to base language in HealthVault (e.g. en).

remarks.para: This method always calls HealthVault service to get the latest information. To improve performance and latency, it is recommended that the calling applications cache the return values, and only call this method to update their cache.
This method currently requires ApplicationConnection or AuthenticatedConnection.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Generic.IList<Microsoft.Health.ApplicationDirectoryItem> GetApplicationDirectoryCollection (Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceConnection connection, Microsoft.Health.DirectoryDataOptions options, DateTime lastClientRefreshDate, out Nullable<DateTime> responseLastModified);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationDirectoryItem> GetApplicationDirectoryCollection(class Microsoft.Health.HealthServiceConnection connection, valuetype Microsoft.Health.DirectoryDataOptions options, valuetype System.DateTime lastClientRefreshDate, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTime> responseLastModified) cil managed

Docs.param: defines what set of data in (s) to retrieve. The calling application can request all languages for the response return values.
A instance that specifies the time of the last refresh made by the client.
Returns the response's last modified datetime
Docs.summary: Gets the entire list of application directory items only if any items have been changed since the specified last client refresh date.

returns.para: A collection of application directory items with localized element values available for the best match language or all languages as specified by the . In case of a language match, HealthVault service tries to find caller's current language identifier by first trying to match entire language specifier in the request (e.g. es-US), then just the language base (e.g. es), and as last resort, defaults to base language in HealthVault (e.g. en).

remarks.para: To improve performance and latency, it is recommended that the calling applications cache the return values, and only call this method to update their cache.
This method currently requires ApplicationConnection or AuthenticatedConnection.

remarks.para: This method always calls HealthVault service to get the latest information. To improve performance and latency, it is recommended that the calling applications cache the return values, and only call this method to update their cache.
This method currently requires ApplicationConnection or AuthenticatedConnection.
